scenes.title: Deleting Instagram, gaining focus
scenes.main_point: Removing Instagram freed time and attention for intentional reading.
scenes.scene_summary: After deleting Instagram, I had more time, energy, and attention to read intentionally.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A person at home sets down a phone showing Instagram deleted and opens a book.
Quiet reading routine, calm and focused.

scenes.title: Curiosity-led reading and Feynman’s warning
scenes.main_point: Reading followed curiosity, and Feynman’s quote warned against self-deception.
scenes.scene_summary: I read by curiosity for one hour daily, and Feynman warned I was easiest to fool.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A person sits at a desk at home, reading with a one-hour quota noted beside them.
On the desk are the books “The Beginning of Infinity” and “Ego is the Enemy,” with Richard Feynman’s quote written on a nearby note as a warning.

scenes.title: High ego blocks learning and progress
scenes.main_point: High ego created false stories, blocked beginner mindset, and delayed doing necessary work.
scenes.scene_summary: High ego made me fear looking stupid, avoid practice, and chase purpose over basics.
key_elements: Refusing to learn from a kid
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A young adult with a guitar hesitates to practice, tense and self-conscious, in a simple room.
Nearby, a kid demonstrates a basic chord while the adult turns away, clutching a notebook labeled “purpose” instead of doing the basics.

scenes.title: Bad explanations vs. good explanations
scenes.main_point: Bad explanations and authority blocked truth; questioning and humility led to better understanding.
scenes.scene_summary: Bad explanations resisted questions, but seeking good explanations kept humility and reduced self-deception.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
In a simple lecture hall, David Deutsch gestures toward a chalkboard labeled “Bad explanations” and “Good explanations” while a stern religious authority figure stands with crossed arms.
A student raises a hand to ask a hard question; Deutsch listens calmly, the authority looks resistant.
